item.title: What & Why of this website
item.description: Since quite some time I have been maintaining a notebook with ideas that cross my mind. These are ideas that are directly influenced by the miniscule amount of knowledge that I have and hence are, by all means, trivial in nature. Hence my only intention with this website is to put forward a (hopefully) unique perspective on topics that I am interested in. The topics can range from science to philosophy and religion.

item.title: Division by zero
item.description: When you search for the phrase “division by zero” on Google, you get many unique takes on this problem. The general theme of all explanations is “You can’t”. Some explanations even introduce new different form of number lines in an attempt to get to an answer for division by zero, which I think is pretty cool. You might even wonder – is there even a possibility of adding more to to this than what already exists?

item.title: Learning by guided discovery
item.description: Set the context and establish what is already known and believed to be true. Ask a question that can be derived from already eastablished context. Try and answer the question. Add answer to already established context. Repeat until satisfied. context = setup what is already known learn() { while (not satisfied) { // dsdds questions = ask_questions_from(context); foreach question of questions { answer = try_answer(question); append(context, answer); } } }
